before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"3ftfq","text":"All solvents and chemicals used are listed in the ‘Materials’ section. These are excluded from in-line references to maintain clarity and keep the steps concise.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"29pn3","text":"An analysis method was developed to allow for quantitation of muconic acid isomers (cis, cis and cis, trans) and aromatic compounds by ultra high pressure liquid chromatography paired with diode array detection (UHPLC-DAD). This was achieved by reproducible preparation of c,c and c,t isomers of muconic acid and chromatographic separation using a mobile phase gradient to separate various aromatic analytes and muconic isomers on a UHPLC reverse phase analytical column.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":84,"length":9},{"style":"italic","offset":97,"length":10},{"style":"italic","offset":273,"length":3},{"style":"italic","offset":281,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

funders.funder_name: This work was authored by the National Renewable Energy Laboratory, operated by Alliance for Sustainable Energy, LLC, for the U.S. Department of Energy (DOE) under Contract No. DE-AC36-08GO28308. This work was performed as part of the Agile BioFoundry (ABF) and was supported by Office of Energy Efficiency and Renewable Energy (EERE) and Bioenergy Technologies Office (BETO).

guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"2rbnm","text":"This protocol utilizes an ultra-high pressure liquid chromatography diode array detection (UHPLC-DAD) system manufactured by Agilent Technologies as referenced in 'Materials'. A similar chromatography and detection system can be utilized; however, some parameter nomenclature may deviate depending on the manufacturer. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fe6pp","text":"Calibration Curve","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"79m1i","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b6c2a","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4uejj","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cautj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cnkh0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6hsbs","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5hlua","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"height":201.41818181818184,"id":443315,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"f19pd\",\"text\":\"Example calibration curve preparation (click to enlarge)\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/png","originalFile":{},"original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/ps7xbjm37.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/ps7vbjm37.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/ps7wbjm37.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/ps7ubjm37.webp","width":580}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"bf4nj","text":"Reporting limits and linear ranges may vary and should be determined for each instrument and analyte individually. The standard ranges provided by the manufacturer are suggested starting amounts and may change depending on detector response.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5tvtr","text":"Multiple strategies are utilized when performing this analysis to ensure instrument stability and reproducibility. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1u80i","text":"Standards","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9q50a","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1vh8u","text":" This procedure for standard preparation is previously documented in our work published as the National Renewable Energy Laboratory (NREL) Laboratory Analytical Procedure (LAP) 'Determination of cis,cis-and cis,trans-Muconic Acid from Biological Conversion' (https://www.nrel.gov/docs/fy19osti/74473.pdf). Preparation of both cis,cis- and cis,trans-muconic acid isomer standard solutions are outlined in LAP sections 10.1.3 and 10.1.4 and below in protocol step 2.1. Both standard working solutions of c,c and c,t isomers of muconic acid are prepared at 1 g/L concentrations in 0.05% v/v sodium hydroxide solution (preparation of sodium hydroxide is outlined in the referenced LAP, section 10.1.2 and below in step 2.1). Each muconic acid isomer is to be prepared in separate calibration curves in subsequent steps, the isomers should not be combined due to the tendency for c,c to irreversibly isomerize to c,t-muconic over time at room temperature.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":177,"length":81},{"style":"italic","offset":326,"length":7},{"style":"italic","offset":339,"length":9},{"style":"italic","offset":502,"length":3},{"style":"italic","offset":510,"length":3},{"style":"italic","offset":875,"length":3},{"style":"italic","offset":908,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":259,"length":44}],"data":{}},{"key":"flrba","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ee5au","text":"The LAP uses the following acronyms:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dt5ga","text":"c,c-muconic acid (ccMA)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":3},{"style":"italic","offset":18,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"25igs","text":"c,t-muconic acid (ctMA)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":3},{"style":"italic","offset":18,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"80FB73D3AF1F11EE8CED0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.nrel.gov/docs/fy19osti/74473.pdf"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4skrb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1lf54","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fgj72","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"amv4n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ek22g","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"height":572,"id":443319,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"bvoa8\",\"text\":\"Elution order including muconic acid isomers and aromatic analytes analyzed using 'Aromatics Mix Large Rev. 1 Standard Mix'. Diode array detection wavelength signals are overlaid here to display analytes in elution order in one chromatogram\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/png","originalFile":{},"original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/ps73bjm37.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/ps7zbjm37.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/ps72bjm37.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/ps7ybjm37.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d2lh4","text":"Additionally, aromatic analytes compatible with this method are listed in the 'Materials' section. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d3gc6","text":"Preparation of aromatic analyte standard stocks should be performed in a compatible solvent for compound solubility. A 1 g/L concentration ampule of Aromatics Mix Large Rev.1 (detailed in 'Materials') is used and diluted in UPW to reach relevant calibration curve concentrations. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2qphf","text":"Method Specifications","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":21}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"70dvi","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1c7rt","text":"Analysis of muconic acid isomers and aromatics is performed using an Agilent 1290 series ultra high performance liquid chromatography (UHPLC) system with a diode array detector (DAD). Complete method parameters are in the tables 'Materials'.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"do31i","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"f7l4s","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4904v","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6r0u4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7b4f8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5qjd9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"height":408,"id":432454,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"avseh\",\"text\":\"Defined UHPLC parameters (click to enlarge)\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/png","originalFile":{},"original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/pgkhbjm37.png","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/pgkgbjm37.png","type":1,"width":550}},"1":{"type":"image","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"height":434.0072727272726,"id":432452,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"bajl2\",\"text\":\"Defined UHPLC-DAD parameters (click to enlarge)\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/png","originalFile":{},"original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/pgkfbjm37.png","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/pgkebjm37.png","type":1,"width":481.2580645161289}},"2":{"type":"equipment","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"brand":"Phenomenex","can_edit":1,"file":{"icon":"","id":null,"name":"","source":""},"guid":"452C7235341F11EE9D4302C0B41BC903","image":{"icon":"","id":null,"name":"","source":""},"link":"https://www.phenomenex.com/part?partNo=00D-4475-AN","name":"Kinetex ","sku":"00D-4475-AN","specifications":"1.7 µm / 100 x 2.1 mm / 100 Å","type":"reverse phase analytical column","vendor":{"id":1756,"image":{"placeholder":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png","source":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png"},"is_requested":false,"link":"https://essvial.com/","name":"Environmental Sampling Supply"}}},"3":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"b22nc","text":"Muconic acid isomers are quantified using the 265 nm wavelength and aromatics on 265 nm, 280 nm, and 310 nm. Varying wavelength signals can be used for different aromatic compounds and should be chosen at the discretion of the analyst.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{},"guid":"1D98715C989B4CEA8B2D481F24072F86"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b2q39","text":"Mobile Phases","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ev5dm","text":"To make the aqueous 0.2% formic acid, dilute 2.0 mL of formic acid into 1.0 L of 18.2MΩ⋅cm ultrapure water (UPW). Volumetric preparation is optimal. ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"87bon","text":"Acetonitrile is used as the organic mobile phase.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9glsi","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"46ut7","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"n014","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"a6c3u","text":"It is advised to prepare sufficient mobile phase for the entire analysis to reduce the need to add additional mobile phase during an active sequence. Adding mobile phase during an active sequence may cause retention time shifting if the new mobile phase varies in pH or acid concentration. This method uses 5.6 mL of mobile phase per injection, calculate how much mobile phase is needed before beginning analysis.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bumtq","text":"Samples","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dor7c","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8uco4","text":"All samples containing muconic acid require a minimum 5x dilution scheme (4:1 diluent to sample ratio) for reliable quantitation of isomers due to matrix effects causing chromatographic issues. Compounds included in the aromatic mix do not require dilution without the presence of muconic acid. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5t1b4","text":"Samples must be filtered through a 0.2 µm or smaller filter prior to injection on the UHPLC.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"26k1q","text":"Samples expected to be over the linear range of the instrument should be further diluted to be within the calibration range to ensure accurate analysis and avoid carryover.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9gd57","text":"Calibration Curves","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8t88l","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"807jt","text":"A minimum of 5 standard levels should be used.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ankh6","text":"All compounds must have a correlation coefficient (r2) of 0.995 or greater using a linear calibration fit and ignoring the origin.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":52,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c0hu8","text":"10.1.2 from LAP","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"hrs9","text":"Prepare a sodium hydroxide solution (0.05% v/v) for standard preparation. Prepared by adding 66 μL 10N sodium hydroxide with an air displacement pipette to 39.934 mL of UPW measured using a repeater pipette. This solution may be scaled if necessary.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6b655","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3tl5v","text":"10.1.3 from LAP","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dfoha","text":"Prepare the ccMA stock standard by weighing 40.0 ± 0.5 mg of the ccMA standard into a 40 mL amber vial and record the weight of the standard to the nearest 0.1 mg. Add an appropriate volume of 0.05% v/v sodium hydroxide solution using a repeater pipette to make a final concentration of exactly 1.0 mg/mL solution and mix well (vigorous shaking periodically over approximately 1 hour to allow for solubilization). The muconic acid should be completely dissolved before use otherwise the concentration of the standard will be unknown. Record the date of preparation, concentration, and any other pertinent information on the vial and store sealed at 4 °C for up to 4 months (stability study ongoing).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":12,"length":2},{"style":"italic","offset":65,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"373dt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dof76","text":"10.1.4 from LAP","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"21mb9","text":"Prepare the ctMA stock standard by preheating a water bath to 60 ± 3 °C. Weigh exactly 40.0 mg of the ccMA standard into a 40 mL amber vial (vial REQUIRED as ordered per Step 7.2.1; vial variation will lead to heat transfer difference and the reaction time will either lead to incomplete ctMA formation or lactone formation). Record the weight of the standard to the nearest 0.1 mg. Add 39.934 mL UPW or similar using a repeater pipette and mix well. Record the concentration of the standard, date of preparation, and any other pertinent information on the vial. Seal the standard with compatible vial top and place into the water bath so that the liquid in the vial is completely submerged for 2 hours. Shake every 15 minutes (use personal protective equipment as necessary). After 2 hours, immediately add 66 μL of 10 N sodium hydroxide using an air displacement pipette and mix. Store the sealed vial at 4 °C for up to 4 months (stability study ongoing).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":12,"length":2},{"style":"italic","offset":102,"length":2},{"style":"italic","offset":288,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4bmms","text":"Calibration Verification Standards (CVS)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":40}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4ue23","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bta63","text":"A calibration verification standard (CVS) is a standard from the calibration curve that is re-injected every 20 or fewer samples to ensure instrument drift remains within the determined acceptance criteria. Acceptable CVS recoveries for this analysis are within 10% of the expected amount. Acceptance criteria may differ between instruments and should be determined experimentally.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c1u84","text":"Muconic acid should be reported as a sum of the two isomers. While isomerization from c,c-muconic to c,t-muconic is irreversible, environmental conditions (decreased pH, exposure to heat, etc.) may cause further isomerization of c,c-muconic acid to c,t-muconic acid. This will cause a change in the ratios of these isomers but the total muconic acid concentration will remain constant. Discrepancies in data are avoided by reporting the total of c,c-muconic acid plus c,t-muconic acid as a sum of the isomers.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":86,"length":3},{"style":"italic","offset":101,"length":3},{"style":"italic","offset":229,"length":3},{"style":"italic","offset":249,"length":3},{"style":"italic","offset":446,"length":3},{"style":"italic","offset":468,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a0ld4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
